questions.question: What is Node.js?
questions.answer: Node.js is an open-source, cross-platform JavaScript runtime environment that executes JavaScript code outside a web browser. It allows developers to use JavaScript to write command line tools and server-side scripts.

questions.question: What is the event loop in Node.js?
questions.answer: The event loop is what allows Node.js to perform non-blocking I/O operations despite JavaScript being single-threaded. It handles the execution of multiple chunks of your program over time, each time running a piece of your code and then moving on to run another piece.

questions.question: What is npm?
questions.answer: npm (Node Package Manager) is the default package manager for Node.js. It allows developers to install, share, and manage dependencies in their Node.js projects.

questions.question: What is package.json?
questions.answer: package.json is a file that contains metadata about a Node.js project and its dependencies. It includes project name, version, scripts, and list of packages required by the project.

questions.question: What are Callbacks in Node.js?
questions.answer: Callbacks are functions that are passed as arguments to other functions and are executed after the main function has finished its execution. They're commonly used to handle asynchronous operations.
